column2: Assistant Factory Manager is the person in charge of all activities in factory.      An Assistant Factory manager is involved with the planning, coordination and control of manufacturing processes.      They ensure that goods and services are produced efficiently and that the correct amount is produced at the right cost and level of quality.         Job Description / Responsibilities           Have ability to build up strategy for factory development basing on the vision and business plan.       Well Production, finance and workforce planning make sure factory operation runs smoothly and     efficiently.     Production Management:     Calculate factory capacity levels to meet the necessary output required and run at the most efficient for     all production factors including materials, technical, process.     Mechanizing: adopt and install the most modern techniques/ machinery available in the market and     mechanize where possible to increase efficiency and reduce costs.     On time Orders Delivery and good quality products     Daily factory cost analysis is done to maintain the monthly cost / revenue targets are met.     Aware of all risks and troubles in factory and have proper solutions.     Continuous Improvement for all operation activities.     Co-ordinate with all departments for smooth operation and development              Desired profile of the candidate            Reach the set planning & strategy     The best quality for all products.     Well-managed all orders and production team.     Factory always well-organized & efficiency.     Following company procedure and working flow.     Always reviewed & revised production system to have best results     Have at least 5 years working experience in the Manufacturing companies as an assistant factory manager.     Age not over 32 years.     Knows about manufacturing field     Good technical and analytical skills required     Having working experience in plastic factories before is preferable     Good attitude, management skill and interpersonal skill     Hard working, think of ways to improve and increase productivity; willing to work overtime     Not averse to change, must be able to listen and collect opinions from its team, analyze these points and     put new systems into place where necessary             Qualification            Candidate must possess at least a Bachelors Degree     Self-motivated with good leadership qualities     Ability to manage and able to work independently     At least 5 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.

column2: Urgent : Factory Operational In-charge  ( Smal l  Ice Cream Factory ) @  Manchester, England  Our client is India's much loved ice cream brand & operates more than 800+ exclusive Ice Cream Parlors across over 230 cities, making it amongst the largest exclusive ice cream retail chains in India. These represent diverse taste profiles and cater to the needs of millions of customers. Group is a professionally managed global conglomerate with a 70-year-old family business. Group directly employs in excess of 2000 people across several regions of operations, & include the boutique Hotel at Mumbai, Banquets & Catering services, India's  largest ice-cream store chain  ,  lower-calorie ice cream  , the leading  ice cream brand  & Indian food products, of the Middle East , a chain of modern Indian family dining restaurants in India, & other sub-brands. Our client is leading  Ice Cream  Manufacturer of India & UAE They have recently , started new unit in  Manchester, UK  for manufacturing traditional Indian packaged foods like  Paneer, Ghee, small Ice Cream plant  & other  Dairy Products. They are urgently looking for  Factory In-charge @ Manchester, England  Age Group : 25 to 35 Years Minimum Engineering Graduate ( Electrical / Electronics/Mechanical )  About 8 + years of relevant experience in  Ice Cream   in small / Medium size  ice cream  factory Looking for  hands-on person  , who has managed small / Medium size ice cream factory Should be  less specialized  & more  all-rounders  in Ice Cream manufacturing At least 3 years experience in same role (Prior experience as  Factory In-charge  /  Production in charge)  ,( as per UK work permit requirements) Should have stable track record & looking at a long-term association with client UK Visa , will be arranged by client . Should be fluent in  English communication (R,W &S) Essential Functions, Duties & Responsibilities: A)   Maintenance / Project for Electrical / Electronics/Mechanical Engineering  Management of entire maintenance function Preventive , Breakdown & Corrective maintenance Team management Worked in environment with Cooling tower/ Air compressor, DG Boiler/ RO Plant Identify local vendors to provide cost-effective services  Provide constant training to critical staff in various shifts to handle  Electrical / Electronics/Mechanical department  Monitors equipment performance, troubleshoots issues B)  Production / Operation function Production Supervisor oversees and coordinates the production activities to ensure efficient operation and adherence to quality standards  Manage production schedules, coordinating with various departments, and supervising production staff to meet production targets and deadlines Lead production teams to meet short- and long-term goals. Understand Product Yield and continuous improvements  Good understanding of RM and PM Should be able to coordinate for timely despatches of the FG Good understanding of fundamental labor and waste control. Familiar with HACCP, SSOP, GMPs. Implement corrective actions to optimize production processes.  Ensure safety, quality, and productivity Play a key role in maintaining a smooth and efficient production operation in the company. Assist with plant process improvement projects Support and contribute to achievement of facility goals for safety, people, quality, cost-savings C)   Manufacturing process Monitoring & Improvement  Blend Ingredients /  Ice Cream Mixture Pasteurize Mix Homogenize Age the Mix Add Liquid Flavors and Colors Freeze Add Fruits, Nuts, and Bulky Flavorings (candy pieces, etc.) Package Harden You are requested to E-Mail updated resume with following details Current Location Please confirm you are ready to work in Manchester, England Total Experience in Ice cream Industry (In years) Pl. specify production capacity of Ice cream plant you have worked with  Relevant experience of managing small / Medium size ice cream factory ( In years)  Relevant Maintenance / Project experience of Engineering function (In years) Relevant Production / Operation function in ice cream factory (In years) Relevant Manufacturing process Monitoring in ice cream factory (In years) Languages known Please self-rate : your English Communication skills on a scale of 1 to 10 (10 being highest) Current Salary (Fixed + Variable) Expected Salary / Saving potential  Minimum period required for Joining Do you have valid passport & have international experience ? column1: Power Plant Manager  - Fly Ash Management / Utilization
column2: Profile Overview: We are looking for an experienced professional in the FLYASH Thermal sector, who will oversee and manage business operations at the assigned Thermal power plant by setting up the entire operations team for flyash disposal.  Job Description Responsible for setting up the entire operations team. Assisting and overseeing the site engaged in disposing ash from Thermal power for both fly and legacy ash disposal as per the margins agreed by the management. Monitor the work progress on a regular basis and formulate reports as required (daily, weekly monthly, yearly planning etc) Arranging local transporters from power plants to mines/low-lying areas and ensuring that the vehicles run as per expectations.  Maintain diesel stores and track the usage of diesel on a regular basis. Ensure that there is no theft. Helping the subcontractors with gate passes and weighbridge processes. Assisting the team in engaging and monitoring the quantum of bulkers from cement plants and brick plants to enhance the sale/disposal of Silo Ash. Manage good relationships with cement companies and mine owners for their short-term and long-term business needs. Engage with all the sub-contractors and manage the driver requirements. Coordinate with thermal power plants and ensure engagement by maintaining rapport and relationships for further business. Assisting the team in managing all administrative activities and official activities thereby maintaining safe disposal of ash disposal Assisting the team in building the operational team. Need to assist the management or head with any other possible new business opportunities in current locations. Desired Profile Any graduate with 10 to 20 years of experience in FLY ash disposal and management. Should have good understating of transportation and fleet management. Should handle a team of 15 to 20 supervisors Ability to handle the work load and multiple truips Should have a good understanding of managing the ash business and logistics. Should have good negotiation and organizational skills Location- Nabinagar,Chennai,Korba,Jharsuguda,Bhopal, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, MP, Jharkhand, Bihar, Rajasthan,MP, Tiroda, Darlipali, Kudgi, karnataka, Orissa, Gondia, Please send your resume to sudhaya.k@refex.co.in / whatsapp - 75501 12776  if your profile is suitable and also refer your friends for the same. column2: Established in 1986, Sungov is involved in manufacturing of engineered industrial equipment and systems, is looking for a results-driven candidate to head the operations of its new manufacturing plant in Thirumullaivoyal Women's Estate, Kattur, Chennai. The selected candidate shall have overall responsibility of the plant including all aspects of pressure vessel and heat exchanger manufacturing along with similar process equipment.  Handle all activities of operations to ensure on time delivery of orders including but not limited to: Generate multi-level production plans (L1, L2, etc.) for each order assigned to the plant Follow up with Engineering, Purchase departments for on-time receipt of requisite drawings and materials for all orders assigned to the plant Manage manpower by assigning tasks according to plan (cutting, rolling, welding, NDE, inspection, etc.) Manage outsourcing activities to ensure compliance with manufacturing schedule and committed delivery date Interface with client as required Handle plant housekeeping, maintenance and HSE. Handle plant statutory matters like pollution consent, fire license, factory license, etc. Handle plant commercial matters like bills consolidation, cash disbursement, etc. The ideal candidate shall have at least 14+ years of experience in managing operations and production of an industrial equipment manufacturing plant (products like Pressure vessels, heat exchangers, filter vessels, etc.). A Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering is preferred. A performance incentive over and above the fixed CTC will be considered for meeting plant assigned targets.

column2: The Dispatch Manager leads Warehouse & logistics department at unit that includes dispatch executives and a team of FG loading & forklift operators      She or he is responsible for people and team development, motivating the team and ensuring quality performance      Responsibilities include meeting business requirement with timely dispatch, coordinating with Planning, sales & plant production team to ensure optimum availability of FG to cater the requirement      This position must closely work with excise department & transporters to ensure execution of the excise permits within stipulated time      This role will also include obtaining all approvals / permissions from excise to operate the plant along with coaching team members to utilize the processes and facilitate problem-solving on the floor                          Role and Responsibilities                                    Driving dispatch team for achieving individual, team and business unit goals & and maintain a strong team culture                      Develop and maintain detailed written facility policies, standards and procedures (SOP) for the warehouse & Inventory Norms.                      Daily follow up with sales for permits & review status.                      Fulfill all documentation & Maintain excise records as per state excise rules.                      Timely renewal of applicable excise licenses, labels & new brand registration.                      Maintain a personnel structure and staffing level to accomplish the Warehouse and Receiving needs in an effective and efficient manner.                      Daily review of plan vs actual production plan & sharing report with all stake holders.                      Plans and coordinates work, trains and motivates, monitors and evaluates performance of staff; ensures their ability to safely operate material handling equipment to move materials to and from storage configurations; Counsels, records, and disciplines as necessary                      Maintains an equipment structure and level to accomplish the Warehouse and Receiving mission in a safe, effective manner.                      Daily stock reconciliation of Finished goods & ensure same in SAP.                      Ensures materials are staged for counting and inspection and reports materials accurately                      Resolves discrepancies with Accounting regarding invoices, packing slips, and receiver reports.                      Monitors the flow of paperwork from Receiving to Inventory Control for timely data entry. Ensures materials are stored properly to conserve space, quality standards are met, and complies with all safety procedures.                      Oversees the rotation of inventories within the warehouse and makes appropriate changes in the ERP system                      Monitors and measures Receiving and Warehouse performance for accuracy of locator, receiving reporting, movement and storage of material.                      Anticipate and request funding for future dispatch requirements.                      Establish and implement safety systems and ensure high safety standards in the area of control. column2: We are looking for a talented and dynamic Factory Manager( Garment Industries ) to join our Organization. This is a fulltime/direct hire position. If this is something that interests you, apply today. Role & responsibilities     1. Software Knowledge:  Should know the workings of an advanced swing machine and also should be familiar with the operation of production software 2. Production Management: Plan and manage daily production schedules to meet customer demands efficiently. Ensure optimal factory operation while maintaining high-quality standards. Monitor production processes to minimize waste and optimize resource utilization. 3. Quality Control: Implement and uphold strict quality control measures to ensure garments meet established standards. Identify areas for improvement and execute quality enhancement initiatives. Address and resolve quality-related issues in a timely manner. 4. Team Leadership: Lead, motivate, and guide a diverse team of supervisors, technicians, and production workers. Provide training, mentorship, and performance evaluations to foster skill development and productivity. Foster a culture of safety, teamwork, and continuous improvement. 5. Resource Management: Manage resources, including labor, machinery, and materials, effectively to control costs and maximize efficiency. Oversee maintenance and repair activities to ensure machinery operates smoothly. 6. Compliance and Reporting: Ensure strict adherence to all relevant regulations, safety standards, and labor laws. Prepare regular reports on production performance, quality metrics, and cost analysis. 7. Supplier and Vendor Relations: Collaborate with suppliers and vendors to secure quality materials and negotiate favorable terms. Evaluate supplier performance and identify opportunities for improvement. 8. Strategic Planning: Contribute to the development of long-term manufacturing strategies and goals. Identify opportunities for process improvement and cost reduction. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelor's degree in Textile/Garments/Fashion or a related field (Master's degree preferred). Proven experience in a similar role within the Garment and Sewing Industry. Strong leadership and team management skills. In-depth knowledge of garment production processes, quality control, and machinery. Excellent problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Familiarity with compliance and safety regulations. Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
